question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Try to ensure that the generated code is executable for demonstration purposes. Nezha is the protagonist in the animated films "Ne Zha: Birth of the Demon Child" and "Ne Zha: The Devil Child Returns to the Sea" directed by Jiaozi, as well as related works.

Nezha is the third son of Li Jing and Lady Yin. He has a rebellious, mischievous, and impulsive personality, yet remains kind and just. Because he was reincarnated from a demon pill, he is misunderstood by people, feels lonely inside, and craves acceptance.

He has straight bangs, two small buns on top of his head, large panda eyes with heavy eye makeup, and somewhat frightening rows of teeth. He often displays a wicked smile with a hint of cuteness. He wears a golden collar around his neck, a red vest with lotus patterns, brown three-quarter length pants with flame patterns, and a yellow belt. He is a chaotic "demon child" who mistakenly came to the mortal world causing endless trouble. At birth, because the spirit pearl was stolen by Shen Gongbao, he became the reincarnation of the demon pill. Initially, Nezha faced discrimination, rejection, mockery, and hostility from the people of Chentang Pass because he was a demon pill, but as the story progresses, he gradually gains acceptance from the people.

Please use CSS preprocessing to create two files based on the text above: one HTML file and one LESS file.

checklist.title: Is the Nezha character visualization implemented in HTML/CSS?
checklist.description: Check if the code creates a visual representation of Nezha with the specific characteristics mentioned: straight bangs, two small buns, panda eyes with heavy makeup, teeth showing in a wicked smile, golden collar, red vest with lotus patterns, brown pants with flame patterns, and yellow belt. Score 0 if the character is not implemented at all, 5 if only basic features are included, and 10 if all detailed characteristics are present with artistic quality.

checklist.title: Is the LESS preprocessing properly utilized for the styling?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code leverages LESS features effectively: using variables for color schemes related to Nezha (red, gold, brown), implementing nesting for better organization, utilizing mixins for repeated styling patterns, and employing other LESS-specific functionalities like operations or functions. Deduct 3 points if only basic LESS features are used, 5 points if it's mostly just CSS with minimal LESS advantages, and 10 points for comprehensive LESS implementation with clear organization.

checklist.title: Does the implementation include animations that reflect Nezha's character?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code implements animations that represent Nezha's rebellious and mischievous yet kind personality. Look for animations like flame effects, hovering or movement animations that suggest impulsiveness, and transitions that reflect his character development. Score 0 if no animations are present, 5 if basic animations exist, and 10 if thoughtful animations that meaningfully represent the character's traits are implemented.

checklist.title: Is the implementation responsive and adaptable?
checklist.description: Check if the code uses responsive design techniques to ensure the Nezha visualization works across different screen sizes. Verify if media queries are implemented, if relative units are used appropriately, and if the layout adapts well without breaking. Deduct 5 points if major responsive features are missing, and 3 points if adaptation is limited to only certain screen sizes. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as slow loading, missing assets, browser compatibility issues, etc.) and provides fallbacks or graceful degradation. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Interactive elements that respond to user input 2. Creative visualization techniques beyond standard CSS 3. Storytelling elements that reflect Nezha's journey). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant CSS properties or LESS variables that serve the same purpose 2. Unnecessary elements or styling unrelated to Nezha's character 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core visualization is interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating structure/styles/animations), LESS organization (proper use of imports, variables, and mixins), and optimization techniques. Deduct 5 points if global style pollution is found; deduct 5 points if the code structure is overly complex or difficult to maintain; deduct 5 points if best practices for CSS/LESS organization are not followed. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching that aligns with Nezha's character palette 2) Proper layout spacing and visual hierarchy 3) Professional typography that enhances readability and character representation. Deduct 3 points for each visual element that feels out of place with the character, 5 points for clashing colors that don't match the description, and 5 points for poor visual composition. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Hover/click feedback delay â‰¤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual indication of interactive elements. Deduct 5 points for each interaction without feedback, 3 points for stuttering animations or performance issues, and 5 points for confusing or misleading interactive elements. The full score is 10 points.
